result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail.

 Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 9:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez in Court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received a new offer from the State and requested time to review with Defendant. Additionally Defense requested to address bail at the next hearing. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court granted request. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond and Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Bail/Bond and Status hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Court INCREASED Cash Bail to $30,000.00. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed State's Motion for Emergency Bail Review Hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED State's Motion to Modify Bail. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 9:45 am. Hearing will be held Via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn; both appear by video.  Defendant Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Natalia Fajardo. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective N. Stachula. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case remains calendared for a bail review and is adjourned to Branch 46.

ATTORNEY MCGINN WILL BE APPOINTED TO REPRESENT MR. HERNANDEZ; HOWEVER, ATTORNEY MCGINN IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR TODAY'S HEARING. PARTIES SELECTED A NEW DATE.
BAIL/BOND HEARING SCHEDULED FOR AUGUST 4, 2022 AT 01:45 PM. HEARING WILL BE HELD IN-PERSON IN ROOM 113 OF THE SAFETY BUILDING. 
INFORMATION PROVIDED TO MCSO.

State contacted the Court via email regarding Motion for Emergency Bail hearing. 
Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Motion for Emergency Bail Review Hearing; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Oral No Contact Order with P.S.; S.M.M.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Francisco Javier Mercado Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Clerk Contacted ADA Joshua Miles Mathy and the Public Defender's Office via email to schedule Return on Warrant hearing.
Return on Warrant/Intial Apperance scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:15 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Bench Warrant cleared by the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department on July 26, 2022.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
